title: OpenVPN Server
descriptionMarkdown: The [OpenVPN](https://github.com/OpenVPN) data connector provides the capability to ingest OpenVPN Server logs into Microsoft Sentinel.
additionalRequirementBanner: This data connector depends on a parser based on a Kusto Function to work as expected [**OpenVpnEvent**](https://aka.ms/sentinel-openvpn-parser) which is deployed with the Microsoft Sentinel Solution.

sampleQueries.query:
OpenVpnEvent
 | summarize count() by tostring(SrcIpAddr)
 | top 10 by count_

dataTypes.name: Syslog(OpenVPN)
dataTypes.lastDataReceivedQuery:
OpenVpnEvent
            | summarize Time = max(TimeGenerated)
            | where isnotempty(Time)

value:
OpenVpnEvent
            | summarize LastLogReceived = max(TimeGenerated)
            | project IsConnected = LastLogReceived > ago(30d)

instructionSteps.description: >**NOTE:** This data connector depends on a parser based on a Kusto Function to work as expected [**OpenVpnEvent**](https://aka.ms/sentinel-openvpn-parser) which is deployed with the Microsoft Sentinel Solution.

instructionSteps.title: 1. Install and onboard the agent for Linux or Windows
instructionSteps.description:
Install the agent on the Server where the OpenVPN are forwarded.

> Logs from OpenVPN Server deployed on Linux or Windows servers are collected by **Linux** or **Windows** agents.

parameters.title: Choose where to install the Linux agent:

instructionSteps.title: Install agent on Azure Linux Virtual Machine
instructionSteps.description: Select the machine to install the agent on and then click **Connect**.

instructionSteps.title: Install agent on a non-Azure Linux Machine
instructionSteps.description: Download the agent on the relevant machine and follow the instructions.

parameters.title: Choose where to install the Windows agent:

instructionSteps.title: Install agent on Azure Windows Virtual Machine
instructionSteps.description: Select the machine to install the agent on and then click **Connect**.

instructionSteps.title: Install agent on a non-Azure Windows Machine
instructionSteps.description: Download the agent on the relevant machine and follow the instructions.

instructionSteps.title: 2. Configure the logs to be collected
instructionSteps.description:
Configure the facilities you want to collect and their severities.

1.  Under workspace advanced settings **Configuration**, select **Data** and then **Syslog**.
2.  Select **Apply below configuration to my machines** and select the facilities and severities.
3.  Click **Save**.

instructionSteps.title: 3. Check your OpenVPN logs.
instructionSteps.description: OpenVPN server logs are written into common syslog file (depending on the Linux distribution used: e.g. /var/log/messages)
